What you do is install Element 3D, and when you start E3D and the serial box comes up, click the button to add license and navigate to the license file. I put mine in the plug-in folder with the .aex file. Bingo.

That's because you have to replace the " .aex " file before you add the license. Let us know if you get a model into AFX.

BINGO! thanks skoxpress
So resuming here is what I did
1.Unrar
2.- Install
3.- Replace the Element.aex file that is under C:Program FilesAdobeAdobe After Effects CS6Support FilesPlug-insVideoCopilot by the one that comes with the torrent
4.-Move the a.license file to the same directory
5.- Open up AFX, make a new layer and apply the effect, once the verification window pop up, choose to install manually, select the license file that you have and voila!
Hope this works

Same fake as all the rest! Don't waste your time

NOT FAKE!!! IT DOES WORK IF YOU FOLLOW THESE STEPS!!!!

1.Unrar
2.- Install (IF YOU HAVE CS6, MAKE ALL THE THINGS DARK EXCEPT FOR CS6)
3.- Replace the Element.aex file and a.license
Files with the original: 
C:Program&Files:Adobe:Adobe After Effects CS6:Support Files: Plug-ins: VideoCopilot 

4.-VERY IMPORTANT!! - Put the "Video Copilot Element 3D 2012 1.0 + license file" Folder on to your desktop

5.- Open up AE, make a new layer and apply the effect, once the verification window pop up, choose to install manually,
Step 1: Select the folder on your desktop:
Video Copilot Element 3D 2012 1.0 + license file
Go in folder "Element3D" and select OK!
Now generate license and select the "a.llicense" in the AE: support: plugins: VideoCopilot folder

Generate, close & you're done! xD

If it didn't worked, then you're a noob & did not follow the steps correctly
